title: Discomfort or Retreat
description: Signs that a conversation participant is uncomfortable or pulling back

situations.strategy: Use gentle check-in or pivot topics

conversation.speaker: Friend A
conversation.message: So I was thinking we could go to that new restaurant downtown for dinner Friday, then maybe check out that concert?

conversation.speaker: Friend A
conversation.message: Everything ok? We could also just do something low-key if you prefer, or rain check if this week is busy for you.

examples.explanation: Friend B's abrupt tonal shift with 'idk whatever' signals potential discomfort with the proposed plans. Friend A responds with a check-in and offers less pressure alternatives.

conversation.speaker: Person A
conversation.message: So I'm thinking we should definitely meet up soon! How about coffee this weekend?

conversation.speaker: Person B
conversation.note: One-word response followed by no further messages

conversation.speaker: Person A
conversation.message: Seems like I might be moving too quickly. No pressure at all - I'm around if you'd like to chat more. Enjoy your week either way!

examples.explanation: Person B's minimal 'Cool' followed by silence indicates discomfort with the suggestion. Person A recognizes this shutdown and provides a warm exit that validates the other person's feelings without pushing further.
